fields.description:
Hello!  Sorry for such a noobie question but I am trying to use our University's public computers to access code from our team account.  When I use keygen I tell it to store the key on my private drive rather than the default, then copy and paste that key into the SSH keys under my account, but then bitbucket can't seem to locate that key to use it.  I can get it to recognize a key placed in the default location on the C drive of the computer (on the hard drive of the specific computer I'm using) but not on any other drive, making it necessary to generate then delete a new key every time I log onto any one of the hundreds of computers here...  I'm sure there's an easy solution, but I'm not familiar enough with all of this to see it...

The error I'm receiving (when trying to pull/push after storing the key to anything but the default location) is:

Permission denied <publickey>.\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.\\
Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists.

Suggestions?

Thanks so much!
fields.summary: SSH storage on private drive (used on public computers) not found

fields.description:
Selecting a Subversion repository at https://bitbucket.org/repo/import gives me the following clientside errors:

* Not a valid URL.
* Unsupported protocol. Please use 'http://', 'https://' , 'svn://' or 'git://.'

The site URL is in the following format (but every format seems to fail): https://svn.COMPANYNAME.net/Clients/COMPANYNAME/web/tools/CodeGen
fields.summary: Unreachable URL incorrectly marked as "Unsupported protocol"

fields.description:
Using the Chrome browser from Android 4.4.2 (KitKat), none of the Bitbucket user selector widgets that I've tried (specifically on the Admin > branch permissions screen) seem to work properly.

Typing a name in the box brings up a completion list that appears to be the first 5 available names (of my bitbucket team in this case), none of which match the text that I've already typed in the selector.  Deleting or typing more text in the selector does not appear to refresh the completion list and there does not appear to be any other way to get it to redisplay using the typed in name as a filter.  Hiding and then redisplaying the Android keyboard doesn't appear to help either.
fields.summary: User selectors don't work properly on Android/Chrome

fields.description:
Hello,

About 2 days ago or so, the <author> tag was dropped off the RSS feed, while I do understand that this was done to mask email IDs from the RSS feed, a suggestion to this would be to replace the email id in the <author> tag to the user's username, like in my case my username is arjitc, perhaps that could be used in the <author> tag ?

This would be much appreciated since I use this and perhaps others do too in their applications / code public changelogs which are generated from the RSS feed :)

Like in my case, the center row had the username in it which was derived from the <author> tag from the RSS feed which is now absent :/\\
http://imgsea.com/changelog
fields.summary: <author> tag dropped from RSS (BB-10200)

fields.description:
From what I am understanding, you are not doing any name blacklisting on pull request URLs. For this reason, if my branch is called "feature/follow", my pull request name will be "../pull-request/21/follow", which conflicts with the existing route for following/unfollowing a pull request.

This ends up in an infinite redirect loop.

Please let me know if I can contribute somehow, if you want you can assign this to me. I would be very happy to contribute.

Cheers,\\
Dan
fields.summary: If my pull request branch name is "feature/follow", everything blows up!

What should I do?

Thank you very much!

fields.description:
Bitbucket issues and issue comments and rendered as Markdown. However, prior to Oct 4th 2012 everything was Creole. Bitbucket still applies Markup based on the issue's timestamp so that old content continues to render in Creole.

However, when converting content from an external, Markdown-only issue tracker to Bitbucket, anything with a timestamp prior to Oct 4th 2012 incorrectly gets rendered as Creole.

So issue exports should be extended to contain the actual markup language for the content. This requires a database change on our end, as this data is not currently tracked.
fields.summary: Issue exports should contain contain a markup field per issue/comment (BB-10088)

fields.description:
First: please add instructions to your support site for what users should do when they find potentially­damaging vulnerabilities with your site. If you don't have instructions for how security issues should be handled, it doesn't give the impression that you care very much.

----
In many cases it is trivial for a malicious user to cause issues and issue comments on BitBucket to be deleted. Their delete links are simple unauthenticated HTTP GET requests. As you should know, these must never be used to trigger the modification of significant data.\\
A malicious user just needs to post a comment that tries to load the delete URL as an image. When that comment is viewed by a user with appropriate permissions, it will cause the target issue or comment to be deleted.

{code}
![](https://bitbucket.org/ACCOUNT/REPO/issue/delete/ISSUE_ID/COMMENT_ID)
{code}

This could be set up to also delete the payload comment, nicely cleaning up the evidence of the abuse. (At least from our perspective. I hope you would have still some internal records/logs.)

----
I have successfully used this technique to cause issues owned by teammates of mine to be deleted, by including the delete URL as an image in one of our team chat rooms.
fields.summary: Issue and comment delete links are unauthenticated GET, vulnerable to CSRF (BB-10093)

fields.description:
As ridiculous as it may sound, I have already emailed Support because I wanted to use BitBucket since *yesterday*, but no one replied and my account is still deactivated (except for the useless Atlassian ID). I used an email alias when registering, but I had to email Support (as suggested) from my real address, so the whole purpose of masking my email is spoiled. After hours of waiting, I had to Google to actually figure that opening an issue here is what seems to really solve the problem.

Let me know if you can finally activate my account (username: MasterFocus) or if I should stick to another git service instead.
fields.summary: Another "account deactivated" victim

fields.description:
Hey Guys,

I know this topic has been opened previously, but from the tickets I saw, there has been no resolution on this.

* https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4193/push-code-to-bitbucket-is-very-very-slow
* https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3866/optimise-network-performance-in-china

Bitbucket has been good to us, but I did not see any obvious warning of it's usage outside the US which would have been a major blocker with us choosing Bitbucket as our repo choice.

Please work with us to figure out some sort of workaround or better a permanent solution so others  can benefit.  I'm fairly quick with responses so I can help out in whatever debugging is neccessary (I can be available during China hours, since I'm located in EST, to help gather more debugging information).

Thanks,\\
~Ravid
fields.summary: Slow network speeds in China (BB-10115)

All except “10-failed-web.eml” were send from [yandex.mail|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details%3Fid%3Dru.yandex.mail] smartphone app. They have pretty much nothing in common except for the app and the sender (excluding some messages which were send from alternative yandex domain).

{{10-failed-web}} probably failed because it did not have quote and thus belongs to BCLOUD-8817. But maybe it the result of the difference in quotes left by yandex.mail and web interface. In any case I do not see why certain quote format and its presence must be a requirement, github works fine with this app.

fields.description:
When you have a "log" entry in an issue which includes "attached" and a comment, such as https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/issue/107#comment-4100590, the actual link to the attachment in that comment is not necessarily correct.  In the case of this specific comment, it appears that the attachment is actually stored under a path that matches a previous name for this issue tracker, "alembic_git".    The reason for this appears to be that the hard-coded path of an attachment comes out in an issue export as the "changed_from" field of a "log" entry (which also appears to be undocumented save for a subtle implication in the documentation's example import, and also it makes no sense why "changed_from" would be used for this).   It's also impossible (or at least, tedious) to predict what this link would be when making an import from an entirely different issue system like Trac, and if you can predict it, it still appears that the name of the target repo has to be hardwired in the link making the issue export file non-portable as far as links to attachments in comments are concerned.

The way this should work is, the Bitbucket issue itself knows the actual URL of the attachment, it has no problem listing it at the top of the the issue, so it shouldn't need be expressed in literal form in the import or export at all, and the link within the comment should just work just as well as it does on the top of the issue display.

Sorry I know this is a bit picky but I'm considering giving up control of my Trac issues for the first time in 8 years ... :)
fields.summary: links to attachments in "attachment created" comments, when exporting/importing issues (BB-10074)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
the clean-git command always return 1 (in force mode or not) :

{code}
#!shell
java -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -jar ../svn-migration-scripts.jar clean-git --force        
# Creating annotated tags...
# Creating local branches...
# Checking for obsolete tags...
No obsolete tags to remove.
# Checking for obsolete branches...
No obsolete branches to remove.
# Cleaning tag names
# Cleaning branch names
zsh: exit 1     java -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -jar ../svn-migration-scripts.jar clean-git --forc
{code}

I don't see any specific error and all seems to have run well, but the 1 exit is disturbing.
fields.summary: clean-git command of svn-migration-scripts.jar returns 1

fields.description:
Our organisation name is long, because the acronym was already taken.

"learningresourcesinternational"

When looking at the list of repositories, the organisation name takes up the viewable space.

We can hover over to see a tooltip, or use the search.

But it would be handy to have an alias (just when viewing our own stuff) so we can shorten the name.

In theory we could choose a shorter name, but we didn't think it would be as much a problem when we signed up. An alias would help.

The repository name is the most important thing to us, maybe the team name should be in a drop down box or something similar?

!http://i.imgur.com/87hBNVv.png!
fields.summary: Long repository owner names make it very difficult to see the repository list (BB-10054)

fields.description:
When using editor in issues tracker, everything is just fine -- width of editor is more or less equal to the width of resulting text, so when you press {{Preview}} you have a nearly WYSIWYG snap of how your issue / comment will look like.

This isn't that pretty in wiki. Wiki's pages are much wider, but when editing them we're using the very same editor with the very same editing window width. So, pressing {{Preview}} for Wiki pages is actually completely useless -- resulting text will have very different layout than what you see in preview mode.

Can this be fixed? Can Wiki page's editor width be aligned to match actual Wiki page layout and produce a much better WYSIWYG experience?
fields.summary: Change editor size, when on-line editing wiki pages (BB-10055)

fields.description:
Gravatars stops being displayed on Bitbucket, if only they have rating any higher than {{G}} (general). This is way to tough, in my opinion. You should consider allowing at least {{PG}} (parental guidance) rated gravatars.

gravatar.com's definition for {{PG}} is: "_PG rated gravatars may contain rude gestures, provocatively dressed individuals, the lesser swear words, or mild violence_". That isn't to high, as for developers, right? :]

I don't know, if this is valuable, but as my supporting argument, I say, that entire Stack Exchange network (quite very similar to Butbucket, at least in terms of target audience -- developers) allows gravatars rated at {{PG}} and only blocks {{R}} or {{X}} rated ones.
fields.summary: Change allowed gravatar's rating to PG

fields.description:
Recently (2-3 weeks ago?) bitbucket.org started behaving strange.

* If I start FF with bitbucket in a tab, it won't load and the address bar is blank. The favicon is still there, though.
* Almost everytime I click a link within Bitbucket, nothing happens. Clicking the second time works. Opening a link in a new tab or window produces a blank tab. Opening the link in another tab again works.

Different things I tried to resolve it:

* I have tried FF26 and 27
* Safe mode (that is, no addons)
* Clear cache, cookies etc
* Reset FF (which made me have to install all the addons again :))

One thing I'm wondering, is if you've started using some JS library for click tracking or something? Or updated one recently?
fields.summary: All links in Bitbucket site needs to be clicked twice using Firefox

fields.description:
This has happened twice, with two unique branches from 'default' on one of my repositories.  When using the "sync now" feature to update each branch from default, the request completes, however I'm unable to pull down / checkout the updated branch.

Mercurial prints an error similar to the following:\\
abort: No such file or directory: /path/to/my/working/copy//some_directory/some_file.ext

Notice the insertion of a double slash (//) in the path...

When this happens, it appears to render the branch useless because it fails to checkout on any platform without throwing that error.

Merging default into a branch with SourceTree or Mercurial CLI works fine...and this is what I've done to work around the issue...creating a fresh branch from a previous commit, and merging with SourceTree.
fields.summary: Intermittent issue with "sync now" on Mercurial branches causing path corruption (BB-10051)

fields.description:
The markdown extension allows us to set align headers using ':' notation. However it uses an old {{align}} parameter that isn't supported by browsers anymore.

For example:

||Row1 Cell1||Row1 Cell2||Row1 Cell3||
|Row1 Cell1|Row1 Cell2|Row1 Cell3|
|Row2 Cell1|Row2 Cell2|Row2 Cell3|
fields.summary: Markdown table cell alignment is not honoured (BB-10049)

fields.description:
Consider a private team with an admin member. The workflow adopted is 'forking'.

a) The admin member creates a private repository and assign it to the team as owner.

b) The access page now shows <team name> as owner and <admin name> as creator.

c) Some team members are given read access to this repository.

d) These team members privately fork the repository (ensuring that permissions are inherited) and begin work.

e) The admin member sees 0 forks on the repository and cannot monitor the team's copies.

f) The admin member cannot be granted any further access as he/she already is 'creator'.

g) Workaround is that if logged in with the team username the number of forks are correctly reported and the member's repos can be watched.

h) However as team logins are soon to be deprecated this will not be possible at all.

In my opinion this is critical functionality for private teams working with a forking workflow.
fields.summary: Repository creator (team admin ) does not have access to private forks by other team members

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# On a given account "abc" and repo "def", create a branch with some UPPER case characters, e.g., "DEV-1-new-issue". The branch url would looks like: https://bitbucket.org/abc/def/branch/DEV-1-new-issue
# Rename the account name from "abc" to "Abc" (or anything else)
# visit the original branch url

* Expected: be redirected to https://bitbucket.org/Abc/def/branch/DEV-1-new-issue
* Actual: be redirected to https://bitbucket.org/Abc/def/branch/dev-1-new-issue (note the lower case "dev") and got 404
fields.summary: Redirect of branch url incorrectly converts branch names to lower case (BB-10034)

fields.description: It should be possible to obtain a list of all the teams the currently logged in user is a member of.
fields.summary: Add an API to list a user's teams (BB-10039)

fields.description:
Whenever I rebase/rewrite my history in a git repository, it shows in the repository overview every commit since the commit I rebased as "stripped".\\
I think it would be worth it to find a way to detect which commits were affected in the history rewrite, or at _least_ show only one notification with all the stripped commits aggregated.
fields.summary: History rewrites pollute repository overviews

fields.description: See [BB-10037|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-10037]
fields.summary: Make 2.0 API consistent with the naming conventions on the site (BB-10037)

fields.description:
Hi,

Push requests are very slow (40 kB/s) today. We check our internet access, it works fine.\\
This is not the first time and it is a real issue for us. The kind of issue which makes us think to change of service.

Actually, programmers find bitbucket service generally slow.

Do you have plans to improve the performance of the service in Europe ?\\
I am thinking about hosting bitbucket service in Europe by example.

Thanks,

Regards,

Julien Fayolle

Can't delete group

fields.description:
The following directory in our repository is not longer accessible:

https://bitbucket.org/trijezdci/m2r10/src/tip/_STANDARD_LIBRARY/BLUEPRINTS/

Trying to access the page returns a "500 Something went wrong" page. The page lists a debugging code: 01b2ae0787774c4f9ceaf2381a6382b4

Note, all recent commits in this directory are still visible through the commits list at

https://bitbucket.org/trijezdci/m2r10/commits/branch/default

The data is evidently still there, but the web interface seems to be broken.

Please can you look into this so we can continue to work on the files in that directory, thanks.
fields.summary: Getting "500 Something went wrong" on repo directory

fields.description: It doesn't seem possible to change source branch for HG pull request - the drop-down is available, but its empty.
fields.summary: Change source branch for existing Mercurial PR

fields.description:
Heya :)

I'd love to be able to group repositories in a team/personal account under projects.

I have well over 50 repositories across the two companies i work for, and having one list of repositories is not the greatest interface. Often a Project will involve 3-5 repos yet there is no way to group them like that within a team.

If there were a simple way to just group them in the list (other than alphabetical sort) it would help a lot.
fields.summary: Projects/Repository Groups

fields.description:
Like this:

* https://github.com/blog/1227-commit-status-api
* http://blog.travis-ci.com/2012-09-04-pull-requests-just-got-even-more-awesome/

Because why wouldn't you, it's easy, and we just added this to our Jenkins server for GitHub repos.
fields.summary: Support third-party pull request statuses

fields.description:
Use case:\\
http://vim-wiki.mawercer.de/wiki/index.html\\
worked fine with github: use a small script to sync online edits with github repository.

For (least priviledge) reasons it would be nice if the same could be done @ bitbucket:\\
Create a new key which only gets write access to https://bitbucket.org/vimcommunity/vim-git-wiki so that online changes can be pushed automatically.

Deployment keys get close: They allow to upload a key and associated it with one repository only. But you cannot push. Thus I recommend extending deployment keys adding an option allowing the user to choose between read only (current behaviour, should be default) and (rw, opt-in) - for some special use cases like mine

Of course I could create a new user and grant access to the repository. However I feel that's overkill.

I talked to Jesse Yowell (support) who suggested me creating a ticket (BBS-7401)

Marc Weber
fields.summary: Extend deployment keys to allow both: read/write

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Wiki -> Edit Home
# Ensure that syntax is markdown is selected.
# Post the following tag:

{code}
[TOC]
{code}

# Click Save

Expected result: TOC with links to other pages.

Actual result: empty page content.

Please fix the TOC, without marking of this issue as duplicate, because the {{[TOC]}} tag still not working for the Home page and the markdown syntax.
fields.summary: Fix [TOC] tag.

fields.description:
It seems the "create branch" feature on the web site doesn't properly prevent creating branches that appear as a "subdirectory" of an existing branch.

I made a test repository here: https://bitbucket.org/fluff/bitbucket-test-branch-slash

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a branch through the web interface, for example "test"
# Create another branch through the web interface, like "test/another"

Result:

* Step 2 produces a 500 "something went wrong" page (this may be useful in debugging the problem: a3b120c0f7e9461194d4b63a4b8fca30 )
* The invalid branch is still listed in the project's recent activity feed + the dashboard recent activity feed
* Clicking the link to the invalid branch yields a 404 page.
* The branch doesn't actually exist and doesn't appear in the branches page (as expected)
fields.summary: Create git branch from web with existing branch + "/" prefix yields 500 and 404 errors (BB-10036)

fields.description:
The team accounts are changing and I won't be able to login using my team account around 18 Feb.  However, the team account "owns" the repositories and apparently, the groups in use by the account which we use to control access.  I have not found a way to manage those groups using an administrator account.

How can an administrator account manage the groups (and other assets) of the "owner" account?
fields.summary: How to manage groups owned by a Team account

fields.description: When a branch has + in the name, the Commits page works fine, but visiting the Branch page shows "need more than 1 value to unpack."
fields.summary: Can't browse branches with +'s in the names (BB-10032)

fields.description:
I just took a look at my reported issues on https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/issues?section=reported and some bug I reported way back is now appearing twice, with the duplicate in a strange repository "jhocman/iridium". The link to the duplicated issue leads to an "Access denied" page. Weird :)

Attaching a screenshot.
fields.summary: Private issues appearing in the dashboard (BB-10031)

fields.description:
I uploaded a pretty big git repository (OK it's git's own repository) and noticed that the commit messages weren't showing up in the directory listing. I used my browser's network profiler and noticed it was failing on this URL:

https://bitbucket.org/xhr/source-lastmod/OEP/git/0d6cf2471f426dd2b742e2285aad78381738be96/

When visiting the page, it gave me a code:

{{b6ebc71d6c1e4d27a534295247bfe056}}
fields.summary: GET /xhr/source-lastmod/* request throws "500: Something went wrong" (BB-10030)

fields.description:
After creating a new repository, I went to "Access Management" to assign groups and permissions.  I was not happy to find that a set of groups had already been assigned access to the repository.  I had to remove most of them and reassign as I needed.

Why does BB make assumptions as to which of my groups should be assigned to new repositories?  I see this as reckless, given that we have several disparate groups, including outside contractors.

How can I manage these assignments, as in remove all assignments and leave it to me to make them myself according to the individual needs of each repository?

I don't know what "Kind" of ticket this is, so I'm leaving it as a bug.
fields.summary: Groups assigned to new repositories

fields.description:
The diff in a comment is now colored: green for new lines red for deleted lines. This could be prettier, for example by coloring the changed parts of a line dark green.

This is in particular useful when using git with LaTeX.

Sometimes, this is already done, but often, e.g., when splitting lines, this is not done!

For a more complete example, check the p4merge tool, there, this is built-in in a much more general way.
fields.summary: Pretty diff

fields.description:
* 

A lightweight wordpress plugin that helps you to login to your site by using a "Login by BitBucket" system and it enables developers to run most of server side ability in plugin or theme by using of BitBucket API, This includes access to all features of the version 1 and version 2 Bitbucket API .

So a developer can to create wordpress plugins or themes using of a simple php class named {{WP_Bucket}} and BitBucket API.

This plugin created based on {{OAuth}} class and {{wp_remote_request}} function.

h2. [Read More ...|https://bitbucket.org/khosroblog/wp_bucket/wiki/Home]
fields.summary: A wordpress plugin for Login by Bitbucket and so more.

fields.description:
There should be only 2 options for the user on this page, Pay or Cancel.\\
If Cancel is pressed it should redirect to parent URL if parentURL is available.\\
The OK button should be removed - this is seen when Chrome is used, not with Firefox.

Firefox also displays the the awesome header, chrome does not. did not check IE.\\
All changes should be tested in these 3 browsers.
fields.summary: directpay.jsp: Either pay or cancel

fields.description:
directpay.jsp should display the correct customer name and product name. This info should be pulled from the URL parameters cid (customer id) and pid (product id):\\
The URL parameters are like this:\\
http://localhost:8082/pay?cid=io&pid=services&p=x

additionally, "customer name" should be changes to "Customer ID" and "Product Name" should be changed to "Product ID"
fields.summary: Incorrect product and customer name on directpay.jsp

Therefore, the repository can neither be used nor deleted.

fields.description:
See my private repo:\\
https://bitbucket.org/nuklea/unhoused/pull-request/3/issue-7-show-actions

Steps to reproduce:

* Edit pull request
* Destination branch already "default"
* Check "Close Issue7 after the pull request is merged"
* Press "Update pull request"

Get error:

{code}
The following error(s) occurred saving this pull request
Source and destination branches must differ when closing the source branch.
{code}

If I don't check "Close Issue7 after the pull request is merged" -- get no errors, but destination branch don't change to "default".
fields.summary: Cannot change destination branch

fields.description:
This may be the wrong place to direct this question. If it is my apologies.

Would it be possible to treat files with a .webp extension in BitBucket as an image instead of a binary file?

Thanks for your help,

Rob.
fields.summary: .webp support in BitBucket

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add CORS header to the HTTP access to git repos?

This would allow browser based apps using JS git clients to be able to push/pull using smart-http protocol. The only workaround currently is to deploy webapps as Chrome Apps (eg. Tailor, Git-Browser) or FirefoxOS Apps which gives the ability to white-list domains allowed to x-domain access.

This would also depend on https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6666/detect-git-requests-by-content-type-header being fixed first of course.
fields.summary: Enable CORS header for Git repo HTTPS access (BB-10018)
